item.title: History of the Morellic Minikin
item.description: Overview This note goes over the history of the Morellic Minikin. It explains their divergence from the Móra riSéwi, their hybridisation with the Western Kaśtaira, and the founding of Sarvara.

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: Overview Sarvara ( Sarvaran: ‘Our Valley City,’ Sarvárą < *ësa-ëlbhu-aazan) was a settlement founded by the Morellic minikin. It was built on the Abhmýra river, experiencing seasonal floods.

item.title: The Móra riSéwi Tribe
item.description: Overview The Móra riSéwi minikin ( Old Morellic: ‘Children of Mora,’ Móra riSéwi < *moza li-sevi) were a nomadic tribe from around the time of Naíru.

item.title: The Sarvaran Calendar
item.description: Overview The Sarvaran Calendar is a calendar created by the Sarvaran minikin. Year 0 took place on the founding of the city, years before the founding are referred to with the acronym ‘BS,’ meaning ‘Before Sarvara.
